content.location: Far right of Talon, facing downhill.

content.description: A really fun cave problem, full of large holds.  Nice solid lava rock. The crux is getting over the bulge at the mouth of the cave.
content.location: Start at the large undercling that is inside the cave to the far left.  Head up and to the left, around the bulge, and to the top.

content.description: Nice solid lava rock holds, fun and easy until you have to get over the roof.  Getting over the roof at the end of this route is the crux.
content.location: Just right of the clay stripped center that separates the cave and the tall roof, you'll see a jagged hold that's easy to grab.  Start there and head up towards the overhanging roof.

content.description: A few routes can be found on the shady northwest side of this boulder, which includes a cave feature and 20 foot roof feature right next to each other. this boulder is made up of lava rock, with some red clay composite running down the center. Though the center of this boulder is unusable, the cave and roof feature are solid lava rock. Landing is pretty good, big enough to fit large pads.
